album.title: Now That's What I Call Music, Vol. 79

wiki.summary: "pov" is the fourteenth track from Ariana Grande's sixth studio album, Positions. It was released on October 30, 2020 through Republic Records. In the song, Ariana Grande sings about her partner's ability to see her from a more positive perspective, wishing that she could see herself that way. The acronym "pov" stands for "point of view," suggesting a change in perspective and a deeper understanding of oneself through the eyes of a loving and supportive partner. Read more on Last.fm.
wiki.content: "pov" is the fourteenth track from Ariana Grande's sixth studio album, Positions. It was released on October 30, 2020 through Republic Records. In the song, Ariana Grande sings about her partner's ability to see her from a more positive perspective, wishing that she could see herself that way. The acronym "pov" stands for "point of view," suggesting a change in perspective and a deeper understanding of oneself through the eyes of a loving and supportive partner. The lyrics express gratitude for a partner who sees her true essence, flaws, and all, and helps her view herself with love and acceptance. The song's emotional depth and vulnerability resonate with listeners and showcase Grande's introspective songwriting and vocal abilities. Read more on Last.fm.
